summary: This document is an email chain from November 2019 forwarding a report about a potential new victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The report describes a 17-year-old girl from New Mexico who was allegedly abused by Epstein at his New York townhome and his Caribbean island. The emails show the report being forwarded to the FBI for investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the abuse allegations. The document states he abused a 17-year-old girl on numerous occasions at his properties.

persons.name: Ms.
persons.context: A 17-year-old girl from New Mexico who is reported to have been abused by Jeffrey Epstein at his New York townhome and Caribbean island home.

persons.name: Ms.
persons.context: A guardian and very close friend of the alleged victim, based in Calderitas, Mexico. She is helping the victim register a claim against Epstein's estate.

connections.description: The document alleges Epstein abused the 17-year-old victim on numerous occasions at his properties.
The second Ms. is described as the guardian and very close friend of the alleged victim, assisting her with legal claims.

events.title: Report Forwarded to FBI
events.description: An email chain forwards a report about a new alleged Epstein victim to the FBI for investigation.

events.title: Alleged Abuse by Epstein
events.description: A 17-year-old girl was allegedly abused by Jeffrey Epstein on numerous occasions at his New York townhome and his Caribbean island home in the Virgin Islands.

keyFacts: A new alleged victim, a 17-year-old girl from New Mexico, is reported in November 2019, after Epstein's death.
The alleged abuse occurred at Epstein's properties in New York and the Virgin Islands.
The victim's guardian, based in Mexico, was seeking to register a claim against Epstein's estate.
The report of this potential victim was being forwarded to the FBI for investigation.
The document indicates ongoing efforts to identify victims and process claims against Epstein's estate posthumously.
